Package it.unimol.monopoly.app

Class Contract

java.lang.Object
it.unimol.monopoly.app.Contract
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Contract extends Object implements Serializable
Class that defines the Contract object, with all the logical methods for purchasing a contract, paying rent and checking if multiple contracts are equal. Each contract gets automatically created when the match starts and then added to a map inside the ContractManager. It implements the Serializable interface since the state of every contract is saved on a file.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Angelo Trotta

    • Contract

      public Contract(String name, int price, int rentValue)
      It creates a Contract object.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the contract.
      price - Price of the contract.
      rentValue - Value of the rent's price, once a contract is purchased by a player.

      public boolean isAvailable()
      It verifies the availability of a contract, indicating if it has been purchased already or not.
      Returns:
      true if the contract was purchased, false otherwise.

    • resetCounter

      public static void resetCounter()
      It resets the private counter aux of Contract, utilized to dynamically increment the contract IDs at the time of their creation. The method is only used for testing purposes.

    • buyInitialContract

      public void buyInitialContract(Player player, Contract contract)
      It allows the automatic purchase of initial contracts for each player at the start of the match.
      Parameters:
      player - Buyer
      contract - Random contract passed from the ContractManager, which constitutes an initial contract.

    • buyContract

      public boolean buyContract(Player player, Contract contract)
      Method to purchase a contract.
      Parameters:
      player - Player who has to buy a contract.
      contract - Contract to acquire.
      Returns:
      true if the purchase was successful, false otherwise.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      It verifies the equality between two contracts.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - Takes a generic object in input, executes the casting to a Contract object, and checks if the two objects are equal by ID, price, rent, and availability. See Object.equals(Object) for more information.
      Returns:
      true if the equality is verified, false otherwise.
